reviews.review: nice game

perfect story and action i playing 2022 still rock

Do you like half-life? Do you want more? If yes, you should get this add on. It doesn't really do to much to expand on the story, but it does a a lot in the way of guns and gameplay. I also found it more challenging. Don't mistake that for this game being hard. It is not, but it feels like a natural progression from the gameplay of the base game.
shoutout to spin off game characters, gotta be one of my favorite genders

I love how this game still reminds you gordon is still around doing his business with all the references to the og game. Also the fish gun lad was the best character and i hope we see him again in the future!

"Half-Life: Opposing Force" is the first expansion pack Half-Life from 1999, in the last millennia. The player (US. Marine) is sent to the Black Mesa and fights various aliens and black ops units. Story events convey through the use of scripted sequences.

I came to play this game after finishing the remake of the Original Half-life (Black Mesa). I used to play this back in the days with friends. The original Half-life feel is still there. Guns behave nicely and puzzles are engaging. It is nice to see things Black Mesa from another perspective, again. 

I run into a couple of bugs, like the mouse not moving at first or being stuck after loading the next area couple of times. The game is shorter than I remember, only a few hours long. Textures and models now look dated, but overall this was nice trip to the memory lane.

This game deserves similar treatment that Crowbar Collective did to the original Half-Life. Good times!

Super!

This game was beyond my expectations, probably because I played Blue Shift first.
Interesting story with good gameplay, showing you the perspective of the "bad" guys, and that the conflict going on is more complicated than what you could see in the first game. Gameplay is about 5 hours but it offers so much.

The best for me was the new variety of enemies, each of them unique. A lot of new cool alien designs and alien weapons as well. Also added some cool new game mechanics like the grapple barnacle. It actually surprised me how different this game was from the original and actually added a lot of new features.

If you enjoyed Half-Life, you should absolutely play this as well. Definitely much better than Blue Shift, but both are worth playing.
